sub_title: Empowering individuals facing health challenges to discover new career opportunities | Linguist | Polyglot in the making
summary:
The best job is one that combines work with your interests. Ever since I can remember I have loved people - listening to their stories, talking to them and helping them with their problems. And that's exactly what my job is!

As a specialist in the 2nd track reintegration (Dutch: 2de spoor re-integratie), I help people who have been on sick leave for more than a year in their search for a new, suitable job. They often need to make a new plan for their life and future in the Netherlands. And I am there for them to support them on this journey.

My work is also related to my greatest passion - languages! So far, I have coached clients in four different languages (Polish, English, Dutch and Russian). Thanks to the knowledge of several foreign languages and excellent communication skills, I am able to help immigrants. This makes their reintegration more effective. In addition, knowing well the cultural differences between the Netherlands and Poland (and other Eastern European countries) allows for more culture-sensitive, personalized and flexible guidance.

One of my greatest achievements is the development of my career and continuing my education after moving to the Netherlands. What was supposed to be a short trip turned into an adventure of a lifetime. I can't wait to see what the future holds.

profile_positions.description:
As a reintegration advisor, I am responsible for supporting and advising employees who are looking for a new job. I do what is called a 2nd track reintegration (Dutch: 2de spoor re-integratie), which means that I work with employees who are entering the second year of long-term illness and absence from work.

I specialize in helping immigrants from Eastern Europe. So far, I have worked with over 45 clients whom I coached in 4 different languages (Polish, English, Dutch and Russian). Most of them came from Poland. However, I also had a chance to work with people from Slovakia, Bulgaria and Lithuania. Knowledge of languages and intercultural differences helps in effective advice and a personalized approach.
My role in the reintegration process requires empathy and outstanding communication skills. I work with employees who suffer from illnesses, job loss, reside in a foreign country and do not speak either English or Dutch.

My main responsibilities include:
- both physical and online conversations with employees
- regular contact with case managers and employers about progress
- administrative tasks, e.g. documenting conversations and preparation of various reports
- investigating, analysing and mapping the possibilities of an employee on the labor market
- actively looking for suitable job offers
- support and stimulation of the employee's personal development through further training (e.g. language and computer courses), which may increase his or her chances on the labor market
- training related to job hunting, which includes writing a CV, cover letter, preparing for job interviews and other job hunting activities
profile_positions.title: Reintegration specialist and job advisor

I lead a group of 20 people. I was responsible for planning, organising and distributing work. My function required a close cooperation with all departments in the company and regular contact with clients. 

As a supervisor I was responsible for evaluating and coaching people in the group. For this, I took a course for so-called performance review and appraisal interviews (Dutch: functionerings- en beoordelingsgesprekken).

Due to the multicultural nature of the group, my function required daily communication in three languages: Dutch, English and Polish.

profile_positions.description:
Work in the largest insurance company in Central and Eastern Europe. My tasks included:
- receiving calls from customers
- providing assistance in the event of accidents on the road, breakdowns or technical problems
- helping customers in distress
- informing about current products and services
- close cooperation with the team
- taking care of the positive image of the company

- substantive support for co-workers
- listening to phone calls, assessing their quality and providing feedback
- preparing and giving presentations
- increasing the quality of calls and services offered by employees of the Assistance department
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Specialist

profile_positions.description:
I was a member of the first group of students that was responsible for the preparation of new official letter templates that would be linguistically correct and citizen-friendly.

The most important tasks included:
- preparing drafts of official letters
- development of letter templates
- analysis of the lexical, syntactic and stylistic correctness of draft letters, judgments and reasons for judgment prepared by officials and assistants
- entering comments including suggested stylistic and syntax corrections
- preparing a list of the most common errors in internal correspondence and in outgoing letters
- assessment of understanding the content of outgoing correspondence

Internship also included: 
- OSH training (Polish: BHP)
- training about protection of classified information
